content:
• Thursday, March 1, 2012
  • ASNA

    More on Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA): FQ2 easily beats estimates on a 14% Y/Y jump in...

    More on Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA): FQ2 easily beats estimates on a 14% Y/Y jump in revenue. Net earnings jumped 50% as the apparel retailer posted stronger same-store sales, led by its Justice brand. Shares +9.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 PM
  • SATCQ

    More Satcon Technology (SATC): Q4 misses on both counts after posting a 50% decline in Y/Y...

    More Satcon Technology (SATC): Q4 misses on both counts after posting a 50% decline in Y/Y revenue. Gross margin dropped significantly due to $27M in inventory-related charges. The company also drastically cuts its Q1 forecast, now expecting revenues of $22M - $28M. The Street view is fpr revenue of $38M. Shares -6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 PM
  • VLTC

    More on Motricity (MOTR): Q4 misses across the board on lower than anticipated sales in its...

    More on Motricity (MOTR): Q4 misses across the board on lower than anticipated sales in its managed and professional services units. Revenue declined 31% Y/Y as the company struggles to exit the majority of its international businesses and significantly streamline its operations. Shares -7.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +10%) is up 3.5% AH, adding to the gains it saw following the unveiling of Zynga...

    Zynga (ZNGA +10%) is up 3.5% AH, adding to the gains it saw following the unveiling of Zynga Platform (I, II), which might reduce its dependence on Facebook (though it relies on Facebook Credits for now). Ryan Lawler isn't yet convinced Zynga Platform will take off. "It’s notoriously difficult to create a platform and a destination site and to aggregate an audience," he writes, "even one that’s already using your product."

     
     
     
     
    | 7:04 PM
  • PCMI

    More on PC Mall (MALL): Q4 misses estimates on a drop in net sales. Revenue declined 8% Y/Y,...

    More on PC Mall (MALL): Q4 misses estimates on a drop in net sales. Revenue declined 8% Y/Y, largely due to a program change in Q4 by a large vendor. Separately, the company announces it's hired Mark McGrath as President, a position previously held by the Company's Chairman and CEO, Frank Khulusi. Shares -7.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:58 PM
  • KODK

    Bankrupt Eastman Kodak (EKDKQ.PK) agrees to sell its online photo services to Shutterfly...

    Bankrupt Eastman Kodak (EKDKQ.PK) agrees to sell its online photo services to Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) for $23.8M. Accounts of Kodak Gallery’s 75M users in the U.S. and Canada would be transferred to SFLY under the agreement, which is subject to competing bids at an auction. SFLY +17.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:32 PM
  • FL

    Foot Locker (NYSE:FL): Q4 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.5B (+7.9% Y/Y) in-line....

    Foot Locker (NYSE:FL): Q4 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.5B (+7.9% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • NGD

    New Gold (NYSEMKT:NGD): Q4 EPS of $0.09 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $178M (-6.2% Y/Y) misses by...

    New Gold (NYSEMKT:NGD): Q4 EPS of $0.09 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $178M (-6.2% Y/Y) misses by $15M. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • DCP

    DCP Midstream Partners (DPM) -4% AH after announcing a 4.75M share stock offering, good for...

    DCP Midstream Partners (DPM) -4% AH after announcing a 4.75M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $233.7M based on today's close. DCP says it will partly use the offering's proceeds to pay down debt obtained through its revolving credit facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • CCSC

    Country Style Cooking Restaurant Chain (NYSE:CCSC): Q4 EPS of -$0.08 may not be comparable to...

    Country Style Cooking Restaurant Chain (NYSE:CCSC): Q4 EPS of -$0.08 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.11. Revenue of $43.3M in-line. Shares -18.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • SATCQ

    SatCon Technology (SATC): Q4 EPS of -$0.40 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $36M (-50.4% Y/Y) misses...

    SatCon Technology (SATC): Q4 EPS of -$0.40 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $36M (-50.4% Y/Y) misses by $1.3M. Shares -2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • PCMI

    PC Mall (MALL): Q4 EPS of -$0.03 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.26. Revenue of $399M...

    PC Mall (MALL): Q4 EPS of -$0.03 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.26. Revenue of $399M (-8.4% Y/Y) misses by $7M. Shares -5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • VLTC

    Motricity (MOTR): Q4 EPS of -$0.14 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $24.5M (-31.9% Y/Y) misses by...

    Motricity (MOTR): Q4 EPS of -$0.14 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $24.5M (-31.9% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -15.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • IMRS

    IMRIS (NASDAQ:IMRS) beats on Q4 revenue results but trades lower in the post-session after...

    IMRIS (NASDAQ:IMRS) beats on Q4 revenue results but trades lower in the post-session after issuing guidance below Street expectations. It now sees FY12 revenue coming in at $57M - $60M, below consensus estimates of $63M. Shares -5.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • MITL

    Mitel Networks (NASDAQ:MITL): FQ3 EPS of $0.21 in-line. Revenue of $165M (+0.9% Y/Y) misses by...

    Mitel Networks (NASDAQ:MITL): FQ3 EPS of $0.21 in-line. Revenue of $165M (+0.9% Y/Y) misses by $2.5M. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • IDSY

    I.D. Systems (NASDAQ:IDSY): Q4 EPS of $0.07 in-line. Revenue of $11.8M (+63.9% Y/Y) in-line....

    I.D. Systems (NASDAQ:IDSY): Q4 EPS of $0.07 in-line. Revenue of $11.8M (+63.9% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +9.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • ALSK

    Alaska Communications Systems Group (NASDAQ:ALSK): Q4 EPS of $0.05 in-line. Revenue of $87.5M...

    Alaska Communications Systems Group (NASDAQ:ALSK): Q4 EPS of $0.05 in-line. Revenue of $87.5M (+3.2% Y/Y) beats by $3.5M. Shares +5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • FLOW-OLD

    Flow International (NASDAQ:FLOW-OLD): FQ3 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $65.8M (+14.4%...

    Flow International (NASDAQ:FLOW-OLD): FQ3 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $65.8M (+14.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +6.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM

  • The report about an attack on a Saudi pipeline is untrue, claim Saudi oil officials. "They...

    The report about an attack on a Saudi pipeline is untrue, claim Saudi oil officials. "They originated from Facebook and Twitter and the pipeline is still up and running." A screenshot from PressTV says differently. Oil remains higher, but far below its initial spike. WTI crude (USO) +1.7% at $108.92. Brent crude (BNO) +3% to $126.35.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • ESL

    Esterline Technologies (NYSE:ESL): FQ1 EPS of $0.98 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.62....

    Esterline Technologies (NYSE:ESL): FQ1 EPS of $0.98 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.62. Revenue of $471M (+27% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • FOLD

    Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FOLD) falls 5.7% AH after announcing a stock offering. No details...

    Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FOLD) falls 5.7% AH after announcing a stock offering. No details are given regarding the offering size, or the drug developer's plans for the proceeds.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • AUTH

    AuthenTec (NASDAQ:AUTH): Q4 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $18.8M (+29.7% Y/Y) in-line....

    AuthenTec (NASDAQ:AUTH): Q4 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $18.8M (+29.7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -6.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • ASNA

    Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA): FQ2 EPS of $0.81 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $862M (+14.6%...

    Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA): FQ2 EPS of $0.81 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $862M (+14.6% Y/Y) beats by $33M. Shares +10.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • SPWR

    SunPower (SPWR -2.8%) dips on a tepid initiation with a Neutral rating at Brigantine. The firm...

    SunPower (SPWR -2.8%) dips on a tepid initiation with a Neutral rating at Brigantine. The firm says visibility is likely to remain poor through 2012, and growth in China will not be enough to offset declines in Europe.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor (TRIP -0.3%) drifts lower after BofA Merrill Lynch cut the shares to Neutral on...

    TripAdvisor (TRIP -0.3%) drifts lower after BofA Merrill Lynch cut the shares to Neutral on valuation earlier today, citing excessively high near-term growth expectations.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • MU

    Micron (MU +1.7%) continues this week's strong run after Alpha One Capital's Dan Niles comes on...

    Micron (MU +1.7%) continues this week's strong run after Alpha One Capital's Dan Niles comes on CNBC singing the company's praises, citing cheap valuation and Elpida's bankruptcy. The stock could rise another 30%-50%, Niles says, as it had been trading below book value until recently and Elpida's not the last company that's likely to go bankrupt among DRAM makers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM

  • Already up on the day, crude oil flies higher on a report of an attack and explosion on a Saudi...

    Already up on the day, crude oil flies higher on a report of an attack and explosion on a Saudi pipeline. WTI crude (USO) +2.3% to $109.48, Brent crude (BNO) +3.7% to $127.20.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 8 Comments
  • END

    FBR Capital says any pullback in Endeavour (END +4.5%) is a buying opportunity. Shares sold off...

    FBR Capital says any pullback in Endeavour (END +4.5%) is a buying opportunity. Shares sold off briefly yesterday on the company's announcement of a slight delay in Bacchus production, but FBR says the company has the ability to quickly increase production. The firm reiterates its Outperform rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • ZNGA

    "It's very, very complementary to what Facebook is offering," says Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) COO John...

    "It's very, very complementary to what Facebook is offering," says Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) COO John Schappert, explaining why FB needn't be alarmed by the new Zynga.com. "A first step towards an eventual divorce," suggests Frank Cifaldi, noting Zynga feels it can grow its player rolls best by having a site and feed dedicated to just gaming.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • BID

    Sotheby's (BID -10.4%) shares sink after Q4 profit slumped 26%; CFO William Sheridan blames...

    Sotheby's (BID -10.4%) shares sink after Q4 profit slumped 26%; CFO William Sheridan blames Europe: “If you have a Picasso and you’re concerned with what’s going on in Europe, you may just say, ‘Let me wait 12 months until I see some stability there.'" But there was also narrowing margins from commissions due to “competitive pressures to win high value consignments."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • INN

    Summit Hotel Properties (INN -2.2%) trades lower after Janney Capital cut the shares to Neutral...

    Summit Hotel Properties (INN -2.2%) trades lower after Janney Capital cut the shares to Neutral from Buy on valuation earlier today, citing a lack of visibility.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • DISH

    Shares of Dish Network (DISH -2.2%) dive after sitting calmly in positive territory for most of...

    Shares of Dish Network (DISH -2.2%) dive after sitting calmly in positive territory for most of the day. A report tipping off that the FCC won't grant the company a waiver appears to be the culprit.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +5.5%) unveils the Zynga Platform - bringing "new ways to play and more people to...

    Zynga (ZNGA +5.5%) unveils the Zynga Platform - bringing "new ways to play and more people to play with" - as it tries to create a presence outside of Facebook (NASDAQ:FB). Newly designed Zynga.com will have (among others) 5 of the firm's top games. "Connect and play with more people, beyond your Facebook friends." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • PJC

    Shares of Piper Jaffray (NYSE:PJC) move back down after the company deflates rumors that it's...

    Shares of Piper Jaffray (NYSE:PJC) move back down after the company deflates rumors that it's selling itself to a Chinese securities firm, indicating only that a possible joint venture in the region is on the table. After rising as much as 9.8%, PJC now trades up 3.1% on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • CVO

    Printing services firm Cenveo (CVO +26.2%), which had 13.2% of its float shorted as of Feb. 15,...

    Printing services firm Cenveo (CVO +26.2%), which had 13.2% of its float shorted as of Feb. 15, skyrockets after reporting Q4 revenue of $485.5M (+11.8% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.29; the latter beat Street estimates by $0.10. Cenveo, which is also announcing cash tender offers for its $459M in high-interest debt, says it expects 2012 free cash flow of $100M-$110M. Rival QUAD soared yesterday after posting its Q4 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • EIX

    Edison International (EIX +3.5%) trades up after missing on Q4 revenue but beating EPS estimates...

    Edison International (EIX +3.5%) trades up after missing on Q4 revenue but beating EPS estimates late yesterday. Earnings actually swung to a loss on the quarter, largely due to several large write-downs, but the Street is taking it as a positive as it helps to clarify the company's strategy for its merchant power unit.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • MDR

    McDermott International (MDR +16%) soars despite missing on its Q4 results across the board. Net...

    McDermott International (MDR +16%) soars despite missing on its Q4 results across the board. Net earnings swung to a loss on project writedowns and higher expenses, but this masked a solid 53% Y/Y jump in overall revenue for the quarter. The company also noted its outlook for FY12 has improved based on positive developments in Brazil and Mexico.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 5 Comments
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources (DNR +2.7%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Neutral at Sterne Agee, saying the...

    Denbury Resources (DNR +2.7%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Neutral at Sterne Agee, saying the company's off to a solid start in 2012, benefiting from strong Williston Basin results and successful asset sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • CRZO

    Carrizo Oil & Gas (CRZO +5.3%) gains on an upgrade to Add on valuation at Capital One,...

    Carrizo Oil & Gas (CRZO +5.3%) gains on an upgrade to Add on valuation at Capital One, citing its potential asset sales and growth opportunities in its Eagle Ford stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • MWW

    A host of career and professional staffing names are moving higher off the flurry of speculative...

    A host of career and professional staffing names are moving higher off the flurry of speculative buying engulfing Monster Worldwide (MWW +17.1%). Dice Holdings (NYSE:DHX) +5.1%, Hudson Highland Group (HHGP) +4.9%, LiveDeal (NASDAQ:LIVE) +4%, Manpower (NYSE:MAN) +3.8%, CDI Corp. (NYSE:CDI) +3.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • PACT

    HiSoft Technology (HSFT +20%) soars after its Q4 beat estimates late yesterday. Revenue spiked...

    HiSoft Technology (HSFT +20%) soars after its Q4 beat estimates late yesterday. Revenue spiked 53% Y/Y as sales came in strong across all business lines. The company also raised 2012 guidance above what the Street was projecting, now expecting its EPS to be $1.14 - $1.18 on revenues of $285M. The Street view is for an EPS of $1.08 on revenues of $260M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • HUSA

    A trading halt can't stop the freefall of Houston American Energy (HUSA -30.1%) after the...

    A trading halt can't stop the freefall of Houston American Energy (HUSA -30.1%) after the company admits it had to cap one of its wells unexpectedly. Shares hit a multi-year low in intraday trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • MAXR

    DigitalGlobe (DGI -13.9%) makes a new 52-week low after missing Q4 EPS forecasts, and guiding...

    DigitalGlobe (DGI -13.9%) makes a new 52-week low after missing Q4 EPS forecasts, and guiding for 2012 revenue growth of 10% (consensus is for a 12.5% increase). Jefferies is staying positive, arguing the value of DigitalGlobe's earth imagery assets is "substantially greater" than its enterprise value, and positive free cash flow is still possible for 2012. Rival GeoEye (GEOY -3%) is also selling off.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • PEUGY

    Peugeot (OTCPK:PEUGY) ADRs skid 5.1% after Moody's cuts its debt rating a notch to Ba1, the...

    Peugeot (OTCPK:PEUGY) ADRs skid 5.1% after Moody's cuts its debt rating a notch to Ba1, the highest "speculative" grade, and says it faces a further downgrade this year. The agency echoes investor concern about Peugeot's alliance with GM, and warns it would hurt earnings in the short term but might not bring the expected savings later.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • WYNN

    Gambling revenue in Macau jumped 22.3% Y/Y in February, topping $3B, as players from mainland...

    Gambling revenue in Macau jumped 22.3% Y/Y in February, topping $3B, as players from mainland China continued to fuel solid growth, though not at the blistering pace recorded last year. Casinos with Macau exposure rally: WYNN +2.9%, MPEL +3.1%, LVS +2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • BAC

    That didn't take long. Massachusetts Sec. of the Commonwealth William Galvin slams Bank of...

    That didn't take long. Massachusetts Sec. of the Commonwealth William Galvin slams Bank of America's (BAC +2.3%) consideration of new fee structures on its checking accounts, and proposes a law barring banks from holding state deposits if they don't offer basic checking without fees. Expect to hear soon from the new Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 12 Comments
  • ADP

    UBS initiates Automatic Data (ADP +1.2%) and Paychex (PAYX +2%) Buy ratings ahead of what it...

    UBS initiates Automatic Data (ADP +1.2%) and Paychex (PAYX +2%) Buy ratings ahead of what it sees as a U.S. recovery, noting that both companies have limited international exposure and attractive dividend yields.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • EBAY

    Wedbush is singing eBay's (EBAY +1.8%) praises following a meeting with management, arguing...

    Wedbush is singing eBay's (EBAY +1.8%) praises following a meeting with management, arguing PayPal's adoption will continue to surge thanks to retailer frustration with existing payment methods. The firm also believes eBay's 2008 acquisition of Bill Me Later will help PayPal differentiate itself, given the payment option flexibility it provides to customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • LULU

    Lululemon Athletica (LULU +4.3%) is making new highs thanks to a bullish Stifel note, which...

    Lululemon Athletica (LULU +4.3%) is making new highs thanks to a bullish Stifel note, which claims in-store and online checks indicate Lululemon is showing positive momentum going into Spring. In particular, Stifel is encouraged by the "positive consumer response" to new products, minimal clearance activity, and the successful revamp of Lululemon's online store. Lulelemon reports earnings on March 16.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • PJC

    Piper Jaffray (PJC +5.1%) shares jump after Deal Reporter says the company is in exclusive...

    Piper Jaffray (PJC +5.1%) shares jump after Deal Reporter says the company is in exclusive discussions with a Chinese securities firm about a possible takeover, buying a stake or forming a joint venture.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • SODA

    William Blair calls SodaStream (SODA +0.9%) attractive at current levels following yesterday's...

    William Blair calls SodaStream (SODA +0.9%) attractive at current levels following yesterday's selloff over its Q4 results and 2012 guidance. The firm attributes the weakness to softer than anticipated unit shipment growth, but thinks that was the result of transitory issues. The firm maintains its Outperform rating on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • MSFT

    As praise for Windows 8 (MSFT +1.4%) rolls in, hardware partner Nokia (NOK -2.2%) isn't sharing...

    As praise for Windows 8 (MSFT +1.4%) rolls in, hardware partner Nokia (NOK -2.2%) isn't sharing the love. “Mobile World Congress has been a big disappointment for Nokia," Nomura says, with a "very difficult Q1" on the horizon. But a Canalys analyst says NOK isn't getting the credit it deserves for delivering "four credible handsets on a new platform that are competitive in just over a year." (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (SPRD -3.1%), which tumbled yesterday due to the soft Q1 guidance (revenue of...

    Spreadtrum (SPRD -3.1%), which tumbled yesterday due to the soft Q1 guidance (revenue of $158M-$163M vs. $172.1M consensus) accompanying its Q4 beat, falls some more after JPMorgan and Chardan Capital downgrade shares to Neutral. Spreadtrum attributed its guidance to a seasonal drop in orders for its 3G TD-SCDMA chips (used by phones on CHL's network), but there might also be fears of strong competition from MRVL.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • VIVHY

    Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) hurtles 9.75% lower after CEO Jean-Bernard Levy warns its earnings will...

    Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) hurtles 9.75% lower after CEO Jean-Bernard Levy warns its earnings will fall in 2012 and 2013 due to the entrance of a fourth mobile-phone operator in France, where Vivendi owns SFR. The company also said it would cut its dividend. Net profit in 2011 rose 22% to €2.68B, although revenue was flat at €28.81B.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • MWW

    Monster Worldwide (MWW +9.7%) shares jump after CEO Sal Iannuzzi says the board and management...

    Monster Worldwide (MWW +9.7%) shares jump after CEO Sal Iannuzzi says the board and management are “pursuing all other strategic alternatives to increasing shareholder value... [in] any way we can.” Iannuzzi doesn't elaborate, but the “strategic alternatives” phrase often is code that a company could be getting shopped around.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • BRLI

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI +9.1%) pops after beating FQ1 estimates earlier. Revenue jumped...

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI +9.1%) pops after beating FQ1 estimates earlier. Revenue jumped 23% Y/Y on double digit sales growth as the clinical-testing company's patient count has risen and its share of complex, non-routine testing services continues to grow.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • PAYX

    UBS makes a bullish call on Paychex (PAYX +2.3%), initiating shares with a Buy rating and $37...

    UBS makes a bullish call on Paychex (PAYX +2.3%), initiating shares with a Buy rating and $37 price target. Analysts gush over the prospects for the company, saying that it's a "compelling" outside the box opportunity that will eventually benefit from higher interest rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • REPYY

    Spain's Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY +2.8%) and its Argentine subsidiary YPF (YPF +7.3%) recoup some of...

    Spain's Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY +2.8%) and its Argentine subsidiary YPF (YPF +7.3%) recoup some of yesterday's sharp losses on a report the two countries have formed a working group to resolve issues about YPF. Concerns Argentine President Fernandez could announce more state control over the oil giant's operations hit the shares yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • HUSA

    Shares of Houston American Energy (HUSA -23.4%) dive after the company discloses in a regulatory...

    Shares of Houston American Energy (HUSA -23.4%) dive after the company discloses in a regulatory filing that conditions at one of its major wells didn't allow for sufficient testing. As a result, the company says it will be forced to plug the well and evaluate other formations.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • GPS

    February retail sales beat expectations across the board, with the 18 retailers (XRT +1%)...

    February retail sales beat expectations across the board, with the 18 retailers (XRT +1%) reporting results posting 6.4% Y/Y growth, vs. 4.8% consensus. Gap (GPS +7.8%) shook off its long slide to post 4% growth in same-store sales. Kroger (KR +2.2%) beat estimates and offered a strong 2012 outlook. Target (TGT -0.4%) same-store sales grew 7%, but it didn't raise guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM

  • Seadrill (SDRL -4%) Chairman John Fredriksen cuts his stake in the rig operator to 23% from 28%,...

    Seadrill (SDRL -4%) Chairman John Fredriksen cuts his stake in the rig operator to 23% from 28%, netting 5.6B Norwegian kroner ($1B). Fredriksen plans to use the cash to buy more ships despite the glut in the market, and may be able to leverage the money to make $3B worth of acquisitions.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • TUDO

    Chinese video site Tudou (TUDO -12.8%) dives after reporting Q4 revenue of $26.5M (+70% Y/Y,...

    Chinese video site Tudou (TUDO -12.8%) dives after reporting Q4 revenue of $26.5M (+70% Y/Y, above guidance of 55%-60%) and EPS of -$0.20. The company's adjusted net loss was up 49% Y/Y and 156% Q/Q. Tudou, which recently provided some encouraging web traffic data, says it expects revenue growth to accelerate to 70%-75% Y/Y in Q1.
